snippet: President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan ordered an inquiry into an airstrike that he said killed eight children in the country’s east.
abstract: Afghan President Hamid Karzai accuses the North Atlantic Treaty Organization of killing eight children in a coalition airstrike in eastern Afghanistan and orders comprehensive investigation; incident joins growing list of reports of civilian casualties that have caused serious tensions between the United States-led military coalition and the Afghan government.
lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan ordered an inquiry into an airstrike that he said killed eight children in the country’s east.

headline.seo: Children Killed in NATO Airstrike, Afghan Leader Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
